title: Field to Fork: "Food Safety Inspections and Audit Requirements"

tasks.task: ** Farmer educating customers on food safety standards.
subtasks: ** Explain importance of proper food handling and hygiene practices on the farm.
** Highlight the role of government regulations (e.g., USDA, FDA) in enforcing food safety, particularly Good Agricultural Practices (GAP) and Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP).
** Discuss the necessity of HACCP plans for food safety and preventive controls.
** Differentiate between federal (e.g., FDA inspections) and state/ local (e.g., food code) regulatory oversight for retail and food service sectors.
** Introduce private sector standards (e.g., SQF, BRC) and their role in ensuring food safety beyond regulatory requirements.
** Emphasize the importance of regular facility audits and certifications to access larger markets or export opportunities.
** Encourage farmers to adopt best practices in pest management, water quality, equipment sanitation, and personal hygiene to meet food safety standards.
